oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus service, 1995 September 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with music and serpent handling. Many members, male and female handle and one female member of the congregation handles and dances in the twirling motion indicative of the Jolo church. The same congregant handles fire as well. The music comes to an end, and Jamie Coots preaches. Following his sermon, the music and handling of serpents begins again and lasts until the recording ends.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern--Religious life and customs; Dance--Religious aspects; Homecoming; Pentecostal preaching; Prayer; Singing--Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches)--Appalachian Region, Southern
Chafin, Dewey; Christian, Roy; Coots, Jamie, (Gregory James), 1971-2014; Elkins, Barbara; Elkins, Bob; Hollins, Lydia; McCoy, Tim;
Church of the Lord Jesus (Jolo, W. Va.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
